title: Red Sox grooming ex-Yankees prospect Garrett Whitlock for bigger role (UPDATE)
body: Reliever Garrett Whitlock has fortified the Boston Red Sox bullpen.The sky’s the limit for That’s how the  are approaching , acquired from the  in December’s Rule 5 Draft.Whitlock has made three relief appearances for the , not giving up a run in 6.1 innings of work while striking out nine.Whitlock pitched 2.2 innings in Boston’s  over the Chicago White Sox on Monday. Whitlock didn’t allow a baserunner while striking out two.According to the  the Red Sox are in the process of stretching out Whitlock for more mound work.The Globe reports Whitlock “has entered his name into the conversation as a potential starter.” But Cora knows he needs to be smart with Whitlock, who had Tommy John surgery in July of 2019 when he was a Double-A prospect with the Yankees.As a Rule 5 draftee, Whitlock must remain on the Red Sox’s major-league roster all season.
